newsitem.title: USA: Broderbund sees Q4 results below estimates.
newsitem.headline: Broderbund sees Q4 results below estimates.

text.p: Broderbund Software Inc said Monday it expects financial results for the fourth fiscal quarter to be below analysts' estimates.
Broderbund said it sees Q4 net revenues to be between 85 and 90 percent of net revenues for the year-ago period adding that it also expects net income to be below analysts' estimates.
Analysts had expected the company to post earnings for the fourth quarter, ended August 31, of $0.27 a share, according to First Call. The company had earning of $0.33 a share in the year-ago period.

Broderbund said slowing of growth in end-user demand for its products in both domestically and internationally and disappointing revenues from the company's affiliated label products contributed to the weaker results.
The consumer software company also said it expects a net loss in the quarter from Living Books, a joint venture between Broderbund and Random House.
The company plans to release Q4 results after the close of the stock market on October 9.
Shares of Broderbund were 2-5/8 lower at 25 in early morning trading on Nasdaq.
